Course Description: THIS COURSE IS AN OVERVIEW OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDITING CONCEPTS AND STANDARDS.  IT IS AN INTRODUCTION TO THE PRINCIPLES AND PROCEDURES THAT ENABLE THE AUDITOR TO EXPRESS AN OPINION ON THE FAIRNESS AND RELIABILITY OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, THE STUDENT SHOULD BE ABLE TO:

 DESCRIBE THE NEED FOR AUDITS ASSURANCES SERVICES.
 DISTINGUISH BETWEEN THE AUDITS, RISK, MATERIALITY, EVIDENCE AND INTERNAL CONTROL STANDARDS.
 INTERPRET THE ROLE OF TECHNOLOGY ON AUDIT
 DEMONSTRATE THE METHODOLOGY OF PERFORMING  AN AUDIT.
 COMPLETE VARIOUS REPORTS OF AUDIT FINDINGS.
Textbook(s):
THEORY:  MESSIER, A.. AUDITING AND ASSURANCE SERVICES:  A SYSTEMATIC APPROACH.  MCGRAW-HILL     

PRACTICAL: PEACH BLOSSOM COLOGNE COMPANY, PAUL. GLENCOE
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
